page.title: 19OVER WYRESDALE:CHILDREN
page.content: {A CHILD'S POINT OF VIEW}by a 13yr old. {Helping with farm work:}This applies to a lot of children as most live on or near farms. Not many children get up early enough to help with morning chores but most do help with mucking out and haytiming and so on. Lambing is a busy time for all the family and many children find it exciting too, bringing up lambs which have lost their mother is one of the favourite jobs. Cows aren't that popular though! {Pets:}Many children have pet dogs, some of which are farm animals so a large majority of them are collies. {Rivers and swimming:}Most children can swim by the age of seven so water is normally an enjoyable place to be. Children swim and wash their dogs in the rivers which are sometimes also used for cows' drinking water. {Hobbies:}Most prefer outdoor hobbies.
